newsitem.title: USA: Toll Brothers Q2 signed contracts $355 mln.
newsitem.headline: Toll Brothers Q2 signed contracts $355 mln.

text.p: Toll Brothers Inc said Tuesday that the value of sales contracts signed in the second quarter ended April 30, 1997 totaled about $355 million, or 872 homes, the highest for any quarter in the company's history.
The previous quarterly record was the second quarter of 1996, when contracts signed totallled $299.1 million, or 823 homes.
The company said its backlog at quarter end was the highest ever, at about $644 million, or 1,593 homes.

"Consumer confidence, as evidenced by traffic at our communities, still appears quite strong. The luxury market, buoyed by favorable demographics and increasing wealth, is still robust," the company said in a press release.
